title: Windows 7 32bit boots from USB, Windows 7 64bit doesn't boot, same method used

forumNotes.author: Hjanos95
forumNotes.content:
Hello all!  

I would like to run Windows 7 from my USB-HDD.  
Windows 7 32 bit boots fine, but Windows 7 64 bit doesn't boot.  
I used the same method:  
1. I installed Windows 7 to a VHD image in the local hard drive.  
2. I applied set_7_usb_boot.cmd from [here](http://reboot.pro/14186/page__st__15 "")  
3. I copied the VHD to my USB-HDD.  
4. I made a bcd entry  
5. I boot from USB-HDD  

Any ideas what could I do to make this working?

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> Windows 7 32 bit boots fine, but Windows 7 64 bit doesn't boot.  
"doesn't boot" is not enough for anything. ![:loleverybody:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/loleverybody.gif)  
Please describe what happens (like black screen, flashing cursor BSOD - whisch STOP ERROR if BSOD - etc.).  

Can you try booting the .VHD from an "internal" HD; just to rule out the USB "overlay"?  

![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif)  
Wonko

I will integrate SP1 again, I think something went bad through the integration of SP1, that cought the problem.

I integrated SP1 to windows 7 64 bit setup with RT7Lite.  
Then I installed and again I get BSOD 7b error.  
Without the Service Pack it worked fine.  
And now how can I integrate SP1 without damaging USB boot functionality.
